greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = numerator of n/(n+18).
comment: a(n+3), n >= 0, is the denominator of the harmonic mean H(n,3) = 6*n/(n+3). a(n+3) = (n+3)/gcd(n+3,18). - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Jul 04 2013
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
formula: a(n) = n/gcd(n,18), n >= 0. See the harmonic mean comment above, and the _Zerinvary Lajos_ program below. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Jul 04 2013
program: (Sage) [lcm(n,18)/18 for n in range(0, 100)] # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Jun 12 2009
(PARI) vector(100, n, n--; numerator(n/(n+18))) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Feb 19 2019
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 15 2005
